intro: Thamnochortus umbellatus, commonly known as the whitekop or mountain dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow to orange-yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in mountainous regions. It has a rosette of silver-green leaves and produces a cluster of small, fluffy seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Thamnochortus umbellatus is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
